Consultant, Professional Services  
at Fortinet Location:  Riyadh, Saudi Arabia  
Company Industry:  IT Services  
Job Role:  Network Security Consultation.  
Deliver Professional Services projects.  
Work closely with PMO team to ensure successful completion of projects.  
Provide professional, timely services for Fortinet clients such as:  
Recommending and implementing Fortinet best practices.  
Organizing ad -hoc workshops.  
Creating network security infrastructure designs.  
Developing and maintaining project documentation such as high/low level design documentation, method 
of procedure, test plans, configuration templates, and scripts.  
Installing, provisioning, c ustomizing equipment according to design specifications. o Integrating security 
components, including scripts development.  
Verifying Fortinet configurations based on recommended and approved design.  
Delivering knowledge transfer to client staff.  
Assisting PMO during project scoping.  
Develop new skills based on business requirements.  
Maintain and develop competency on Fortinet’s entire product line and technologies.  
Some of major projects with Fortinet are  listed below:  
  
STC Firewall and FortiWeb deployment . 
 Jarir Book Store security solution . 
 Royal Commission for  Jubail: Firewall migration from Cisco to Fortinet and FortiAnalyzer . 
 NIC: WiFi project.  
 STC: LTE Secure GateWay . 
 Al Rajhi Bank: New Data Center, 6 clusters of firewalls – migration and deployment.  
 
 
 
 
 
 
  
March 2013 - July 2015  
Information Security Advisor  
at Saudi Telecommunication Company. BSc  (honor) in Computer Engineering 2X CCIE (RS+Data 
Center) #29624 Location:  Riyadh, Saudi Arabia  
Company Industry:  Telecommunications  
Job Role:  Information Technology  
Assist in developing & maintaining IT Security related procedures.  
Advise on the acquirem ent of IT security related technology architecture.  
Evaluate IT security related technology architecture.  
Perform Security risk assessment for the dept. initiated projects.  
Propose IT Security technology direction.  
Propose new security initiatives (Technol ogy watch).  
Evaluate and advise on the acquirement of IT security related software.  
Participate in the definition of contractors’ scope of work, develop RFP technical content, and participate 
in the selection of contractors.  
Design ‘best of breed’ IT Secu rity Controls in line with the requirements of the business and in support of 
GDIS strategy.  
Performs security solution modeling and prototyping, and testing of new security solution/equipment and 
security design modifications.  
Define technical access cont rols to minimize security risks.  
Manage implementation and deployment of network infrastructures and services  
Define security process management framework and methodology  
Evaluation of policy and procedures practice within organization  
Developed and implem ented Enterprise Security Awareness Program which addresses organization’s 
needs and effective implementation to change employees attitude towards information security issues 
Reports and updates and status reports to senior management  
Designing and develop ing different modules and providing proper interfaces between them to help ensure 
the high cohesion and low coupling  
Participating in development of test plans for unit testing and formal testing.  
3rd level support for SOC (Security Operation Center)  
Provi ding Bulk SMS and MMS service to STC customers through VPN and Frame relay  
Conducts site readiness surveys / site preparation  
Documents completed implementation projects  
RFP Evaluation  
Security Representation  
Supervise Project Managers  
Supervise the implem entation of Project Management process  
Monitoring project status and progress and reporting directly to the director on project related issues  
Manage and coordinate activities related to the department involvement in other Saudi Telecom projects  
Assistant in planning and forecasting budgetary requirements  
 
• Some of the projects are listed below:  
- AntiDDOS Project

- Upgrade all IPS in STC  
- NMS and SEIM POC evaluation  
- STC Data Center Enhanc ement Project  
- STC HCS new Project Cloud  
December 2007 - March 2013   
Network Expert  
at Emircom Location:  Riyadh, Saudi Arabia , Lulua Bldg. Riyadh KSA.  
Company Industry:  IT Services  
Job Role:  Information Technology  
As a Network Expert, I design and implement the projects which involve Cisco IP infrastructure, Security 
and Fortinet Security technologies. The tasks related to a project are: presenting the solution, the 
Request for Information (RFI), High Level Design ( HLD), Proof of Concept (POC) and Acceptance 
Criteria.  
My Implementation involves the actual configuration of the devices, fine tuning, documentation (Low 
Level Design), Acceptance test and sign off.  
 
My experience is mentioned in the following points but not inclusive to:  
• Good experience of Cisco Data Center Infrastructure Design & Implementation.  
• Good Experience of Cisco Data Center Infrastructure and Components (Cisco UCS, 7000, Nexus 5000, 
Nexus 2000 and Nexus 1000v.  
• Good experience with Cisco AS As, IPS and CiscoIOS Firewall.  
• Good experience with Cisco ISE (Identity Service Engine); presales and implementation.  
• Good understanding of Routing protocols RIP, EIGRP, OSPF, BGP.  
• Good Experience of Cisco Switching technology; VLANs, 802.1q trunks,  STP, RSTP, MSTP, 802.3d 
LACP, InterVlan routing, etc.  
• Good understanding of Routing protocols RIP, EIGRP, OSPF, BGP.  
 
I also have experience in the following domains:  
 
EzVPN, Remote Access VPN, IPSec VPN and DMVPN  
Email Security.  
Content filtering Syste m. 
Integration of Cisco Security systems like ACS and ACE with Windows Active Directory, Wireless 
Controller, LDAP and RSA for Authentication, Authorization and Accounting.  
Implementation and management of secure wireless/cabled infrastructure.  
Investigat e security breaches and suspected security breaches.  
Implementation and management of secure wireless/cabled infrastructure.  
Assist internal and external resources to perform penetration testing of our customers’ networks.  
April 2007 - December 2007   
Seni or Security Engineer  
at Mobily Location:  Riyadh, Saudi Arabia , RIYADH  
Company Industry:  Telecommunications  
Job Role:  Information Technology  
As a member of Mobily Security Operation Center, we perform the following tasks on routine and mostly 
on daily basi s: 
Managing the access permissions for LAN/WAN.  
Securing Network from Virus and external threats.  
Firewalling. CISCO, JUNIPER and HUAWIE  
IDS / IPS Implementation  
Usage of Network / Security Management tools.  
Designing Network Security Design architecture s  
Network security assessments.  
Security Operations Center team is responsible for developing (in terms of fine tuning) and maintaining 
the information security in Mobily. It performs the daily systems and network security operations and tasks 
using the a ppropriate security management tools and resources reserved for the team. The team is 
responsible for performing procedures and monitoring services using the selected products and tools.  
 
The team's responsibility is the follow -up and monitor current secur ity status, any incidents and abnormal 
and suspicious activities or conditions, as well as acting upon alarms and violations. These 
responsibilities may include troubleshooting, problem solving, corrective actions and reporting to take 
place according to t he service level that has been agreed.  
 
The daily operative tasks include for example granting of user rights or user/network access on the basis 
of information owner's request with a filled -in form.  
 
SOC is also responsible for the routine testing of the Mobily security department systems and network 
devices, operating applications for remote access and authentication, monitoring accountability events.
